children.text: The slab has been fully checked in all areas, and we can confirm that there are no areas where the slab surface finish is outside of the allowable tolerances.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 1.02 Finish to External Paving states that
‘Concrete paving finish is defective if it is not consistent in colour, texture and general appearance’
. Additionally, clause 2.11 Finish to Concrete Slabs, states
‘The finish to a concrete slab is defective if it is not suitable for the documented applied finishes such as tiles, polished concrete, carpet or sheet flooring, including set downs where required’ .
This item is to confirm that the house slab surface finish is generally within the allowable tolerances, and there is no action required from the builder at this stage in relation to this issue.
